name: BBQ Chicken Thighs with Grilled Corn and Avocado-Tomato Salad
description: Quick, family-friendly braai chicken glazed with barbecue sauce, served with charred corn and a fresh avocado-tomato salad.
prep_steps: Preheat the outdoor grill to medium-high heat.
Pat dry the chicken thighs with paper towel.
In a bowl, mix chicken thighs with olive oil, barbecue rub, salt, and black pepper.
Husk the corn and remove silks.
Dice tomatoes, cube avocado, and thinly slice red onion.
In a large bowl, add mixed greens, tomatoes, avocado, and red onion. Squeeze lemon over and drizzle with olive oil; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Toss gently and set aside.
Pour barbecue sauce into a small bowl with a brush ready for glazing.
cook_steps: Place chicken thighs on the hot grill, skin-side down if skin-on. Grill 6–8 minutes per side until cooked through (juices run clear).
During the last 2–3 minutes, brush chicken generously with barbecue sauce on both sides and let it glaze without burning.
Grill the corn alongside the chicken, turning every 2–3 minutes until lightly charred and tender, about 10–12 minutes.
Rest chicken 3 minutes. Taste salad and adjust lemon/salt if needed.
Serve chicken with grilled corn and the avocado-tomato salad.
